Comments_List: Basic econometric techniques, how to select among these techniques according to situations of interest, etc.
This course improved my skills in analyzing problems in econometrics. It also provided me with knowledge of several topics in econometrics.
I think this course is taught very well and the material covered is very extensive and in depth.
Strength: Prof. Kitamura's explanation is very clear. The contents are also very interesting and useful for students majoring empirical economics as well as econometrics.
No obvious weaknesses. Yuichi Kitamura was an excellent instructor.
Written notes (difficult to figure out when I wrote something down wrong)

Students who have taken some basic econometrics courses should take this course. Although  this course may be mathematically challenging for some students, the contents are useful both for would-be econometricians and empirical economics researchers.
I would gladly recommend this course to any economics PhD student. It is an enjoyable and edifying course. I think that knowing the course content is useful, even for applied microeconomists.
